meanings.definition: Stingy or cheap in spending money
meanings.sent1: She was so chinchy that she never wanted to buy anything new.
meanings.sent2: The chinchy man always looked for the cheapest items at the store.
meanings.sent3: It was quite chinchy of him to only offer to pay for half of the meal.
meanings.sent4: Her chinchy ways were like a dark cloud over their shopping trips.
meanings.sent5: The image of her counting every penny was the epitome of chinchy behavior.

meanings.sent1: The chinchy fabric tore easily after just a few uses.
meanings.sent2: He regretted buying the chinchy headphones as they broke within a week.
meanings.sent3: The chinchy toy fell apart as soon as it was taken out of the box.
meanings.sent4: The chinchy paint job on the car started peeling off in no time.
meanings.sent5: The chinchy materials used in the construction made the building look shabby.
